co.paralleluniverse.capsule

Class Jar

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.paralleluniverse.capsule.Jar

  • public class Jar
extends Object
    A JAR file that can be easily modified. This class is not thread-safe.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Jar()
      Creates a new, empty, JAR

      Reads in the JAR from the given File.

      Reads in the JAR from the given InputStream.
      Jar(Path jar)
      Reads in the JAR from the given Path.
      Jar(String jar)
      Reads in the JAR from the given path.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Jar

        public Jar()
        Creates a new, empty, JAR

      • Jar

        public Jar(InputStream jar)
    throws IOException
        Reads in the JAR from the given InputStream. Modifications will not be made to the original JAR file, but to a new copy, which is then written with write().
        Throws:
        IOException

      • Jar

        public Jar(Path jar)
    throws IOException
        Reads in the JAR from the given Path. Modifications will not be made to the original JAR file, but to a new copy, which is then written with write().
        Throws:
        IOException

      • Jar

        public Jar(File jar)
    throws IOException
        Reads in the JAR from the given File. Modifications will not be made to the original JAR file, but to a new copy, which is then written with write().
        Throws:
        IOException

      • Jar

        public Jar(String jar)
    throws IOException
        Reads in the JAR from the given path. Modifications will not be made to the original JAR file, but to a new copy, which is then written with write().
        Throws:
        IOException

    • Method Detail

      • getManifest

        public Manifest getManifest()
        Returns the manifest of this JAR. Modifications to the manifest will be reflected in the written JAR, provided they are done before any entries are added with addEntry().

      • setAttribute

        public final Jar setAttribute(String name,
               String value)
        Sets an attribute in the main section of the manifest.
        Parameters:
        name - the attribute's name
        value - the attribute's value
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if entries have been added or the JAR has been written prior to calling this methods.

      • setAttribute

        public final Jar setAttribute(String section,
               String name,
               String value)
        Sets an attribute in a non-main section of the manifest.
        Parameters:
        section - the section's name
        name - the attribute's name
        value - the attribute's value
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if entries have been added or the JAR has been written prior to calling this methods.

      • setListAttribute

        public Jar setListAttribute(String name,
                   List<String> values)
        Sets an attribute in the main section of the manifest to a list. The list elements will be joined with a single whitespace character.
        Parameters:
        name - the attribute's name
        values - the attribute's value
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if entries have been added or the JAR has been written prior to calling this methods.

      • setListAttribute

        public Jar setListAttribute(String section,
                   String name,
                   List<String> values)
        Sets an attribute in a non-main section of the manifest to a list. The list elements will be joined with a single whitespace character.
        Parameters:
        section - the section's name
        name - the attribute's name
        values - the attribute's value
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if entries have been added or the JAR has been written prior to calling this methods.

      • setMapAttribute

        public Jar setMapAttribute(String name,
                  Map<String,String> values)
        Sets an attribute in the main section of the manifest to a map. The map entries will be joined with a single whitespace character, and each key-value pair will be joined with a '='.
        Parameters:
        name - the attribute's name
        values - the attribute's value
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if entries have been added or the JAR has been written prior to calling this methods.

      • setMapAttribute

        public Jar setMapAttribute(String section,
                  String name,
                  Map<String,String> values)
        Sets an attribute in a non-main section of the manifest to a map. The map entries will be joined with a single whitespace character, and each key-value pair will be joined with a '='.
        Parameters:
        section - the section's name
        name - the attribute's name
        values - the attribute's value
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if entries have been added or the JAR has been written prior to calling this methods.

      • getAttribute

        public String getAttribute(String name)
        Returns an attribute's value from this JAR's manifest's main section.
        Parameters:
        name - the attribute's name

      • getAttribute

        public String getAttribute(String section,
                  String name)
        Returns an attribute's value from a non-main section of this JAR's manifest.
        Parameters:
        section - the manifest's section
        name - the attribute's name

      • getListAttribute

        public List<String> getListAttribute(String name)
        Returns an attribute's list value from this JAR's manifest's main section. The attributes string value will be split on whitespace into the returned list. The returned list may be safely modified.
        Parameters:
        name - the attribute's name

      • getListAttribute

        public List<String> getListAttribute(String section,
                            String name)
        Returns an attribute's list value from a non-main section of this JAR's manifest. The attributes string value will be split on whitespace into the returned list. The returned list may be safely modified.
        Parameters:
        section - the manifest's section
        name - the attribute's name

      • getMapAttribute

        public Map<String,String> getMapAttribute(String name,
                                 String defaultValue)
        Returns an attribute's map value from this JAR's manifest's main section. The attributes string value will be split on whitespace into map entries, and each entry will be split on '=' to get the key-value pair. The returned map may be safely modified.
        Parameters:
        name - the attribute's name

      • getMapAttribute

        public Map<String,String> getMapAttribute(String section,
                                 String name,
                                 String defaultValue)
        Returns an attribute's map value from a non-main section of this JAR's manifest. The attributes string value will be split on whitespace into map entries, and each entry will be split on '=' to get the key-value pair. The returned map may be safely modified.
        Parameters:
        section - the manifest's section
        name - the attribute's name

      • addEntries

        public Jar addEntries(Path path,
             Path dirOrZip)
               throws IOException
        Adds a directory (with all its subdirectories) or the contents of a zip/JAR to this JAR.
        Parameters:
        path - the path within the JAR where the root of the directory will be placed, or null for the JAR's root
        dirOrZip - the directory to add as an entry or a zip/JAR file whose contents will be extracted and added as entries
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IOException

      • addEntries

        public Jar addEntries(String path,
             Path dirOrZip)
               throws IOException
        Adds a directory (with all its subdirectories) or the contents of a zip/JAR to this JAR.
        Parameters:
        path - the path within the JAR where the root of the directory/zip will be placed, or null for the JAR's root
        dirOrZip - the directory to add as an entry or a zip/JAR file whose contents will be extracted and added as entries
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IOException

      • addEntries

             ZipInputStream zip)

        path - the path within the JAR where the root of the zip will be placed, or null for the JAR's root

      • setReallyExecutable

        public Jar setReallyExecutable(boolean value)
        If set to true true, a header will be added to the JAR file when written, that will make the JAR an executable file in POSIX environments.
        Parameters:
        value -
        Returns:
        this

      • setJarPrefix

        public Jar setJarPrefix(String value)
        Sets a string that will be prepended to the JAR file's data.
        Parameters:
        value - the prefix, or null for none.
        Returns:
        this

      • setJarPrefix

        public Jar setJarPrefix(Path file)
        Sets a file whose contents will be prepended to the JAR file's data.
        Parameters:
        file - the prefix file, or null for none.
        Returns:
        this

      • setOutputStream

        public Jar setOutputStream(OutputStream os)
        Sets an OutputStream to which the JAR will be written. If used, this method must be called before any entries have been added or the JAR written. Calling this method prevents this object from using an internal buffer to store the JAR, and therefore, none of the other write methods can be called.
        Parameters:
        os - the target OutputStream of this JAR.
        Returns:
        this

          throws IOException
